traceability.evidence: 1) In bin/dry-aged-deps.js the CLI implements process.exit(0) when no updates, process.exit(1) when safe updates found in “--check” mode, and process.exit(2) on all error paths. 2) README.md documents “0: No safe updates available”, “1: Safe updates available”, “2: Execution error” under “## Exit Codes”. 3) Help text (shown via --help) includes “exit code 1 if safe updates available, 0 if none, 2 on error”. 4) Exit-code behavior is covered by Vitest suite: • test/cli.check-mode.test.js asserts exitCode 0/1/2 in JSON, table, and XML formats (including the specific 012.0 scenario for no mature updates). • test/cli.error-cmd.test.js asserts exitCode 2 when npm outdated output is invalid JSON. • test/cli-entrypoint.test.js asserts exitCode 2 on invalid format flag and exitCode 0 on --help/--version.
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria for exit-code refinement (0/no updates, 1/updates available, 2/errors), consistency across formats, documentation in README and help text, and test coverage are satisfied.
